title: FFE IN-GAME UPDATES: Week 7
text:
Stormy evening as fall front zips through 
NOTE : Since the William Fleming/William Byrd game was postponed, WDBJ7 will re-play the Pulaski-Northside game on My19 at 10:30 a.m. Saturday morning. 
- N.C. State 10, Virginia Tech 7 (11:41 left 2Q) : The Wolfpack opened the game with a 9-play, 64-yard drive capped off by a 33-yard field goal. N.C. State scored on an 8-yard pass early in the 2Q to take a 10-0 lead. Christiansburg grad Brenden Motley hit Isaiah Ford on a 27-yard touchdown pass to trim the Wolfpack's lead to 10-7 with 11:41 left in the 2Q. 
- William Byrd 7, William Fleming 0 (POSTPONED) : The game has been postponed until 2 p.m. Saturday because of the weather. The Terriers led 7-0 when the lightning delay began. 
- Appomattox 28, Dan River 7 (second half) : The Raiders took a 28-7 lead on a touchdown pass to Buster Henderson. Click here to see the highlight . Around 8:55 p.m., the game went into a lightning delay. 
- E.C. Glass 21, Liberty 21 (halftime) : Kyle Jones' second touchdown of the night gave the Hilltoppers a 21-13 lead. A Devin Carper 65-yard TD run and the ensuing two-point conversion for the Minutemen tied the game at 21 with 1:32 left in the opening half. The game went into a lightning delay around 8:40 p.m. 
- Northside 19, Staunton River 12 (7:24 left 1st half) : On the road, the Vikings took a 12-6 lead on a TD pass from Hardister to Basham. Staunton River later knotted it at 12. The game went into a lightning delay and re-started at 9:05 p.m. After the break, a Sami Abed touchdown run gave the Vikings a 19-12 edge. 
- Heritage 28, Franklin Co. 0 : There has been two lightning delays in the game. 
- Hidden Valley 20, Carroll Co. 0 (halftime) :
